sentences.english: I'm grateful to you for my sacrifices.
sentences.chinese: 我谢谢您们为我做出的捐躯。

sentences.english: She died heroical ly during an assault on the world's second-highest mountain.
sentences.chinese: 在向世界第二高峰的冲击中，她壮烈捐躯了。

sentences.english: While millions were fighting and dying, the profiteers were lining their pockets.
sentences.chinese: 数百万人在打仗捐躯，而奸商们却趁机发不义之财。

sentences.english: Many a man has lived and died for his country.
sentences.chinese: 好多人为国尽忠，为国捐躯。

sentences.english: In the war of resistance against Japanese aggression, more than 70 Wha Chi fighters made their supreme sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 在抗击日本侵略战争中，70多位华支战士为国捐躯。

sentences.english: We shed our blood for our country.
The little hero died for his country and people grieved over him for five days.
sentences.chinese: 这个小英雄为国捐躯了，人们哀悼了他五天。

sentences.english: His son gave his life for the country while he gave his life to teaching.
sentences.chinese: 他儿子为国捐躯而他却投身于教学。

sentences.english: More than 35 million of excellent sons and daughters of the Chinese nation died for their motherland.
sentences.chinese: 3500多万中华民族的优秀儿女为国捐躯。

definition: to sacrifice oneself in a just cause/a victim of a disaster
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
to give one's body for the nation (idiom); to spend one's whole life in the service of the country
to die in an accident/to die for a just cause
to display utter loyalty/to be loyal to the end
to sacrifice one's wealth to save the state (idiom)
lit. although dead, also honored; died a glorious death
to die without regrets (idiom); to sacrifice oneself without hesitation
guard home, defend the country (idiom); national defense
to give up life for righteousness (idiom, from Mencius); to choose honor over life/would rather sacrifice one's life than one's principles
